description: Portrays the work of the motion picture soundman in arranging the set and recording acceptable sync-sound on location. Contrasts the advantages of a sound studio and the problems inherent in recording on location. Discusses three major recording problems and their solutions - accoustical treatment of set, choice and placement of microphone, and controlling unwanted noise including electrical hum in recording equipment.
